docs.title: ARP Spoofer 🌐
docs.text: Welcome to the ARP Spoofer documentation. This tool provides advanced network packet analysis and ARP spoofing capabilities.

docs.title: 📋 Overview
docs.text:
ARP Spoofer is a Python-based tool that enables:

  • 🔍 Real-time packet capture and filtering
  • 📊 Pattern-based traffic monitoring
  • 🌐 MAC address resolution
  • 🖥️ Hostname detection

docs.title: Network Analysis
docs.text:
• Real-time monitoring of network traffic
  • Custom packet filtering options
  • Detailed packet inspection
  • Traffic pattern recognition

docs.title: ARP Operations
docs.text:
• Smart gateway detection
  • Target device mapping
  • Traffic interception capabilities
  • Packet manipulation tools

docs.title: Reporting
docs.text:
• Multiple export formats (HTML, JSON, TXT)
  • Interactive report generation
  • Visual traffic analysis
  • Custom data filtering

docs.title: 📚 Documentation
docs.text:
• Installation Guide - Setup and configuration
  • Usage Guide - Detailed usage instructions
  • API Reference - Developer documentation
  • Contributing - How to contribute

docs.title: 🛡️ Security Notice
docs.text: This tool is intended for educational and authorized testing purposes only. Make sure to: - Only use on networks you own or have explicit permission to test - Follow local laws and regulations - Be aware of potential security implications

docs.title: 🤝 Support
docs.text:
• Report issues on GitHub
  • Join our community discussions
  • Check out the contributing guidelines

docs.title: 📜 License
docs.text: This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the LICENSE file for details.

docs.title: ARPSpoofer Class
docs.text:
class ARPSpoofer:
    def __init__(self, target_ip: str = None, gateway_ip: str = None, patterns: list = None)
Main class for ARP spoofing operations.

docs.title: scan_network
docs.text:
def scan_network(self, ip_range: str) -> list
Scans network for active devices.

docs.title: spoof
docs.text:
def spoof(self, target_ip: str, spoof_ip: str)
Sends ARP spoofing packets.

docs.title: restore
docs.text:
def restore(self, destination_ip: str, source_ip: str)
Restores ARP tables.

docs.title: get_mac
docs.text:
def get_mac(self, ip: str) -> str
Gets the MAC address for a given IP.

docs.title: run
docs.text:
def run(self, format: str = None)
Main execution method.

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: This project follows the Contributor Covenant.

docs.title: Development Process
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature)
  3. Write your code
  4. Run tests (pytest)
  5. Commit your changes (git commit -m 'Add amazing feature')
  6. Push to the branch (git push origin feature/amazing-feature)
  7. Open a Pull Request

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+
  • pip package manager

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: 
    git clone https://github.com/zeefxd/ARP-Spoofer.git
cd ARP-Spoofer
  2. Install dependencies: 
    pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
For development, install additional dependencies: 

pip install -r requirements-dev.txt

docs.title: Run with default settings
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS
sudo python -m src

# Windows (run PowerShell/CMD as Administrator)
python -m src

⚠️ Note: Root/Administrator privileges are required for network operations

docs.title: Basic Monitoring:
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS
sudo python -m src --target 192.168.1.1

# Windows (run PowerShell/CMD as Administrator)
python -m src --target 192.168.1.1

docs.title: Pattern Matching:
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS
sudo python -m src --patterns "HTTP,FTP"

# Windows (run PowerShell/CMD as Administrator)
python -m src --patterns "HTTP,FTP"

docs.title: Custom Export:
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS
sudo python -m src --format json

# Windows (run PowerShell/CMD as Administrator)
python -m src --format json

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
# Linux/macOS
sudo python -m src -t 192.168.1.10 -g 192.168.1.1 -p "password" "secret" -f html

# Windows (run PowerShell/CMD as Administrator)
python -m src -t 192.168.1.10 -g 192.168.1.1 -p "password" "secret" -f html

docs.title: 📋 Command Options
docs.text: Option Description Default -t, --target Target IP address Auto-detect -g, --gateway Gateway IP address Auto-detect -p, --patterns Search patterns None -f, --format Export format html
